Events that occurred on 24 March

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1834 - William Morris, artist and author who influenced J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
1953 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 136.
1954 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 143c.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 295.
1973 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 349a.
2002 - The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring wins four Oscars, out of thirteen nominations, at the 74th Academy Awards.
2011 - Update 2: Echoes of the Dead, the second update of The Lord of the Rings Online, is released in Europe.
2023 - The Lord of the Rings: Gollum released

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 2510:
Borondir is on his way in search of the Éothéod.
T.A. 3019:
Frodo and Samwise make their last journey to the feet of Mount Doom.
The Host of the West camps in the dreariness of the Morannon.
T.A. 3021:
The last day of the Third Age, according to the reckoning of Gondor.
